channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Exploring Sparse Visual Prompt for Cross-domain Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Therefore, we propose a novel Sparse Visual Domain Prompts (SVDP) approach tailored for addressing domain shift problems in semantic segmentation, which holds minimal discrete trainable parameters (e. g. 10\%) of the prompt and reserves more spatial information.

item.title: Data-centric Artificial Intelligence: A Survey
item.description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is making a profound impact in almost every domain.

item.title: Memotion 3: Dataset on sentiment and emotion analysis of codemixed Hindi-English Memes
item.description: Memes are the new-age conveyance mechanism for humor on social media sites.

item.title: Discovering mesoscopic descriptions of collective movement with neural stochastic modelling
item.description: Collective motion is an ubiquitous phenomenon in nature, inspiring engineers, physicists and mathematicians to develop mathematical models and bio-inspired designs.

item.title: Dynamic Update-to-Data Ratio: Minimizing World Model Overfitting
item.description: Early stopping based on the validation set performance is a popular approach to find the right balance between under- and overfitting in the context of supervised learning.

item.title: High-Dimensional Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search: with Reliable and Efficient Distance Comparison Operations
item.description: Approximate K nearest neighbor (AKNN) search is a fundamental and challenging problem.

item.title: Scribble-Supervised RGB-T Salient Object Detection
item.description: To further polish the expanded labels, we propose a prediction module to alleviate the sharpness of boundary.

item.title: Video Dehazing via a Multi-Range Temporal Alignment Network with Physical Prior
item.description: Video dehazing aims to recover haze-free frames with high visibility and contrast.

item.title: Hospital Length of Stay Prediction Based on Multi-modal Data towards Trustworthy Human-AI Collaboration in Radiomics
item.description: To what extent can the patient's length of stay in a hospital be predicted using only an X-ray image?

item.title: LCE-Calib: Automatic LiDAR-Frame/Event Camera Extrinsic Calibration With A Globally Optimal Solution
item.description: This paper proposes an automatic checkerboard-based approach to calibrate extrinsics between a LiDAR and a frame/event camera, where four contributions are presented.

item.title: Configurable EBEN: Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network to enhance body-conducted speech capture
item.description: EBEN leverages a configurable multiband decomposition of the raw captured signal.

item.title: Understanding why shooters shoot -- An AI-powered engine for basketball performance profiling
item.description: It is crucial that the performance profiles can reflect the diverse playstyles, as well as the fast-changing dynamics of the game.

item.title: Robust probabilistic inference via a constrained transport metric
item.description: The proposed approach finds applications in a wide variety of robust inference problems, where we intend to perform inference on the parameters associated with the centering distribution in presence of outliers.

item.title: SE-GSL: A General and Effective Graph Structure Learning Framework through Structural Entropy Optimization
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are de facto solutions to structural data learning.

item.title: mCPT at SemEval-2023 Task 3: Multilingual Label-Aware Contrastive Pre-Training of Transformers for Few- and Zero-shot Framing Detection
item.description: This paper presents the winning system for the zero-shot Spanish framing detection task, which also achieves competitive places in eight additional languages.

item.title: FreeDoM: Training-Free Energy-Guided Conditional Diffusion Model
item.description: In this work, we propose a training-Free conditional Diffusion Model (FreeDoM) used for various conditions.

item.title: Deep Graph-based Spatial Consistency for Robust Non-rigid Point Cloud Registration
item.description: We first design a local spatial consistency measure over the deformation graph of the point cloud, which evaluates the spatial compatibility only between the correspondences in the vicinity of a graph node.

item.title: Semantic Scene Completion with Cleaner Self
item.description: SSC is a well-known ill-posed problem as the prediction model has to "imagine" what is behind the visible surface, which is usually represented by Truncated Signed Distance Function (TSDF).

item.title: Dual-path Adaptation from Image to Video Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we efficiently transfer the surpassing representation power of the vision foundation models, such as ViT and Swin, for video understanding with only a few trainable parameters.

item.title: A Unified Continual Learning Framework with General Parameter-Efficient Tuning
item.description: The "pre-training $\rightarrow$ downstream adaptation" presents both new opportunities and challenges for Continual Learning (CL).

item.title: Distill n' Explain: explaining graph neural networks using simple surrogates
item.description: We also propose FastDnX, a faster version of DnX that leverages the linear decomposition of our surrogate model.

item.title: A Recipe for Watermarking Diffusion Models
item.description: In this regard, watermarking has been a proven solution for copyright protection and content monitoring, but it is underexplored in the DMs literature.

item.title: On the Effects of Self-supervision and Contrastive Alignment in Deep Multi-view Clustering
item.description: To address this, we present DeepMVC, a unified framework for deep MVC that includes many recent methods as instances.

item.title: Hierarchical-Hyperplane Kernels for Actively Learning Gaussian Process Models of Nonstationary Systems
item.description: Machine learning methods that are used to produce the surrogate model should therefore address these problems by providing a scheme to keep the number of queries small, e. g. by using active learning and be able to capture the nonlinear and nonstationary properties of the system.

item.title: Dynamic Structure Pruning for Compressing CNNs
item.description: In this work, we introduce a novel structure pruning method, termed as dynamic structure pruning, to identify optimal pruning granularities for intra-channel pruning.

item.title: DiGeo: Discriminative Geometry-Aware Learning for Generalized Few-Shot Object Detection
item.description: Generalized few-shot object detection aims to achieve precise detection on both base classes with abundant annotations and novel classes with limited training data.

item.title: SLOPER4D: A Scene-Aware Dataset for Global 4D Human Pose Estimation in Urban Environments
item.description: We present SLOPER4D, a novel scene-aware dataset collected in large urban environments to facilitate the research of global human pose estimation (GHPE) with human-scene interaction in the wild.

item.title: Hubs and Hyperspheres: Reducing Hubness and Improving Transductive Few-shot Learning with Hyperspherical Embeddings
item.description: Distance-based classification is frequently used in transductive few-shot learning (FSL).

item.title: Learning for Amalgamation: A Multi-Source Transfer Learning Framework For Sentiment Classification
item.description: Transfer learning plays an essential role in Deep Learning, which can remarkably improve the performance of the target domain, whose training data is not sufficient.

item.title: TypeT5: Seq2seq Type Inference using Static Analysis
item.description: There has been growing interest in automatically predicting missing type annotations in programs written in Python and JavaScript.

item.title: Predicting discrete-time bifurcations with deep learning
item.description: Here, we train a deep learning classifier to provide an EWS for the five local discrete-time bifurcations of codimension-1.

item.title: Tackling Clutter in Radar Data -- Label Generation and Detection Using PointNet++
item.description: Because there is no suitable public data set in which clutter is annotated, we design a method to automatically generate the respective labels.

item.title: FateZero: Fusing Attentions for Zero-shot Text-based Video Editing
item.description: We also have a better zero-shot shape-aware editing ability based on the text-to-video model.

item.title: The Intel Neuromorphic DNS Challenge
item.description: A critical enabler for progress in neuromorphic computing research is the ability to transparently evaluate different neuromorphic solutions on important tasks and to compare them to state-of-the-art conventional solutions.

item.title: ExoplANNET: A deep learning algorithm to detect and identify planetary signals in radial velocity data
item.description: In this work, a neural network is proposed to replace the computation of the significance of the signal detected with the radial velocity method and to classify it as of planetary origin or not.

item.title: PyVBMC: Efficient Bayesian inference in Python
item.description: PyVBMC is a Python implementation of the Variational Bayesian Monte Carlo (VBMC) algorithm for posterior and model inference for black-box computational models (Acerbi, 2018, 2020).

item.title: Effectively Modeling Time Series with Simple Discrete State Spaces
item.description: For expressivity, we propose a new SSM parameterization based on the companion matrix -- a canonical representation for discrete-time processes -- which enables SpaceTime's SSM layers to learn desirable autoregressive processes.

item.title: Achieving a Better Stability-Plasticity Trade-off via Auxiliary Networks in Continual Learning
item.description: In contrast to the natural capabilities of humans to learn new tasks in a sequential fashion, neural networks are known to suffer from catastrophic forgetting, where the model's performances on old tasks drop dramatically after being optimized for a new task.

item.title: Learning Logic Specifications for Soft Policy Guidance in POMCP
item.description: In this paper, we use inductive logic programming to learn logic specifications from traces of POMCP executions, i. e., sets of belief-action pairs generated by the planner.

item.title: BanglaCoNER: Towards Robust Bangla Complex Named Entity Recognition
item.description: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is a fundamental task in natural language processing that involves identifying and classifying named entities in text.

item.title: Combining Distance to Class Centroids and Outlier Discounting for Improved Learning with Noisy Labels
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new approach for addressing the challenge of training machine learning models in the presence of noisy labels.

item.title: Deep Metric Learning for Unsupervised Remote Sensing Change Detection
item.description: This loss is motivated by the principle of metric learning where we simultaneously maximize the distance between change pair-wise pixels while minimizing the distance between no-change pair-wise pixels in bi-temporal image domain and their deep feature domain.

item.title: Among Us: Adversarially Robust Collaborative Perception by Consensus
item.description: This leads to our hypothesize-and-verify framework: perception results with and without collaboration from a random subset of teammates are compared until reaching a consensus.

item.title: Dataflow graphs as complete causal graphs
item.description: Component-based development is one of the core principles behind modern software engineering practices.

item.title: A New Benchmark: On the Utility of Synthetic Data with Blender for Bare Supervised Learning and Downstream Domain Adaptation
item.description: Moreover, we use the simulation-to-reality adaptation as a downstream task for comparing the transferability between synthetic and real data when used for pre-training, which demonstrates that synthetic data pre-training is also promising to improve real test results.

item.title: FindView: Precise Target View Localization Task for Look Around Agents
item.description: With the increase in demands for service robots and automated inspection, agents need to localize in its surrounding environment to achieve more natural communication with humans by shared contexts.

item.title: Rethinking Model Ensemble in Transfer-based Adversarial Attacks
item.description: Transfer-based adversarial attacks attract tremendous attention as they can identify the weaknesses of deep learning models in a black-box manner.

item.title: CoLo-CAM: Class Activation Mapping for Object Co-Localization in Weakly-Labeled Unconstrained Videos
item.description: Although results are promising, objects are assumed to have minimal movement leading to degradation in performance for relatively long-term dependencies.

item.title: Denoising Diffusion Post-Processing for Low-Light Image Enhancement
item.description: We propose using a diffusion model as a post-processing approach, and we introduce Low-light Post-processing Diffusion Model (LPDM) in order to model the conditional distribution between under-exposed and normally-exposed images.

item.title: Image Enhancement for Remote Photoplethysmography in a Low-Light Environment
item.description: Using collected dataset, we found 1) face detection algorithm cannot detect faces in video captured in low light conditions; 2) A decrease in the amplitude of the pulsatile signal will lead to the noise signal to be in the dominant position; and 3) the chrominance-based method suffers from the limitation in the assumption about skin-tone will not hold, and Green and ICA method receive less influence than POS in dark illuminance environment.
